page.title: 05Eversley Schools
page.content: {St. Neot's}is the main private school in the area. It took over from another school in 1888, which had been converted from a large house at the suggestion of Charles Kingsley in 1867.{Mr. Christopher Hooper,}the present Headmaster, succeeded his father. There are 84 children from 7 to 13 years old, including 48 boarders. The school day begins at 8.30a.m. and finishes at 5.30p.m. There are ten full-time teachers plus part-time staff. {Charles Kingsley School}is a church aided school, founded by the author in 1853. The building has been enlarged many times. There are 150 pupils with five teachers plus the Headmaster,{Mr. {Luke Darlington.}The school is full. Many children come from surrounding districts such as Bramshill, Hartley Wintney and Yateley.
